definitions.definition: to move something by pulling it along a surface, usually the ground:
examples: Pick the chair up instead of dragging it behind you!

definitions.definition: to make someone go somewhere they do not want to go:
examples: She had to drag her kids away from the toys.

definitions.definition: to move something on a computer screen using a mouse
If you drag a subject into a conversation, etc., you begin to talk about it even if it is not connected with what you are talking about:
examples: She's always dragging sex into the conversation.

definitions.definition: to pull nets or hooks (= curved wires) along the bottom of a river or lake in order to find something:
examples: They found the man's body after dragging the canal.

definitions.definition: If you drag and drop something on a computer screen, you move it from one area to another using the mouse.
something that is not convenient and is boring or unpleasant:
examples: Filling in forms is such a drag!
